sen.j: 唯善（ゆいぜん、建長5年（1253年）- 文保元年2月2日 (旧暦)（1317年3月15日））は、鎌倉時代後期の浄土真宗の僧。
sen.e: Yuizen (1253-March 23, 1317) was a priest of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) in the late Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: 「文保元年2月2日」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1317年3月23日 」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Yuizen (1253-March 23, 1317) was a priest of Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) in the late Kamakura period.
Yuizen (1253-March 23, 1317) was a priest of the Jodo Shinshu (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism) in the late Kamakura period.
sen.cmt: Jodo Shinshu に the を追記しました。

sen.j: 父は小野宮禅念。母は親鸞の娘覚信尼。
sen.e: His father was Zennen ONOMIYA.
His father was Zennen ONOMIYA and his mother was a daughter of Shinran, Kakushinni.
sen.cmt: combined this sentence with the one below to reduce sentence fragmentation
sen.e: His father was Zennen ONOMIYA and his mother was a daughter of Shinran, Kakushinni.
His name was Hiromasa.
His given name was Hiromasa.
sen.cmt: added "given" for clarity and to reduce sentence fragmentation
sen.e: His given name was Hiromasa.

sen.j: 大納言阿闍梨と称される。
sen.e: He was called Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Ajari (a master in esoteric Buddhism; a high priest).
He was called Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Ajari (a master in Esoteric Buddhism; a high priest).
He was called Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Ajari (a master in Esoteric Buddhism; a high priest).

sen.j: 下総国関宿西光院（現在の常敬寺）の開山。
sen.e: He was kaisan (a founder of temple as the first chief priest) of Saiko-in Temple (Jokyo-ji Temple as it is known today) in Sekishuku, Shimofusa Province.
He was the kaisan (a founder of a temple as the first chief priest) of Saiko-in Temple (Jokyo-ji Temple as it is known today) in Sekishuku, Shimofusa Province.
He was the kaisan (a founder of a temple as the first chief priest) of Saiko-in Temple (Jokyo-ji Temple as it is known today) in Sekishuku, Shimofusa Province.

sen.j: 初め少将輔時の猶子となり、ついで大納言雅忠の猶子となった。
sen.e: He was first adopted by Shosho Suketoki and next by Dainagon Masatada.
He was first adopted by Shosho Suketoki and then by Dainagon Masatada.
He was first adopted by Shosho (minor captain) Suketoki and then by Dainagon Masatada.
sen.cmt: Shosho に (minor captain) を追記しました。

sen.j: 当初密教を学ぶ一方修験道をあわせて修めた。
sen.e: While he learned about Mikkyo (Esoteric Buddhism) at first, he also pursued the way of Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts).
While he began his studies learning about Mikkyo (Esoteric Buddhism), he also pursued the way of Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts).
While he began his studies learning about Esoteric Buddhism, he also pursued the way of Shugendo (Japanese mountain asceticism-shamanism incorporating Shinto and Buddhist concepts).
sen.cmt: 密教Mikkyo (Esoteric Buddhism) を Esoteric Buddhism に修正しました。

sen.j: その後唯円（河和田の唯円）により他力法門に接して浄土真宗に改宗した。
sen.e: Afterward, he had a chance to encounter other-power (tariki) teaching by Yuien (Yuien of Kawada) and was converted to Jodo Shinshu.
After that, Yuizen received outside help from Yuien (Yuien of Kawada) and converted to Jodo Shinshu.
sen.cmt: 他力: outside help; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: After that, Yuizen received outside help from Yuien (Yuien of Kawada) and converted to Jodo Shinshu.

sen.j: 兄の覚恵に請われて京都大谷に住した。
sen.e: He lived in Otani, Kyoto as requested by his elder brother, Kakue.
As requested by his elder brother Kakue, Yuizen lived in Otani.
As requested by his elder brother Kakue, Yuizen lived in Otani, Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 京都大谷「京都」訳漏れのため, Kyoto を追記しました。

sen.j: 1303年（嘉元元年）関東における専修念仏が禁止されそうになると、関東にくだりこれを護った。
sen.e: When Senju Nenbutsu (the Single-Minded Recitation of the Nenbutsu) was threatened to be prohibited in Kanto region in 1303, he went down to Kanto for protection.
When the Senju Nenbutsu (the Single-Minded Recitation of the Nenbutsu) was threatened to be prohibited in the Kanto region in 1303, Yuizen went down to Kanto to protect it.
sen.cmt: "went down to Kanto for protection" is ambiguous, so I changed it to "went down to Kanto to protect it";
sen.e: When the Senju Nenbutsu (the Single-Minded Recitation of the Nenbutsu) was threatened to be prohibited in the Kanto region in 1303, Yuizen went down to Kanto to protect it.

sen.j: その後覚恵の子覚如と大谷廟堂の相続について争いがあり、それに敗れて祖像の首を持って相模国鎌倉に下った。
sen.e: Afterward, he had a dispute with Kakunyo, Kakue's child about the succession of Otani-byodo Mausoleum, in which he was defeated, and went down to Kamakura, Sagami Province with the head of the founder's statue.
He then had a dispute with Kakunyo, Kakue's child, about the succession of the Otani-byodo Mausoleum and capitulated, returning to Kamakura in Sagami Province with the head of the founder's statue.
sen.cmt: For "敗れる" I changed "was defeated"→"capitulated"; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: He then had a dispute with Kakunyo, Kakue's child, about the succession of the Otani-byodo Mausoleum and capitulated, returning to Kamakura in Sagami Province with the head of the founder's statue.
